title: 108_hr4915
content: The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004" is cited as the short title. It introduces an exclusion for gain from stock of small, publicly traded companies in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004" excludes gain from the sale of section 1203 stock held for over 1 year for non-corporate taxpayers. The exclusion is limited to $100,000 ($50,000 for married individuals filing separately). 1203 stock refers to stock in a qualified small business C corporation acquired after the enactment date, either for money, property, or as compensation for services. The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004" excludes gain from the sale of section 1203 stock held for over 1 year for non-corporate taxpayers. The exclusion is limited to $100,000 ($50,000 for married individuals filing separately). Qualified small businesses are defined as domestic C corporations with a market capitalization not exceeding $150,000,000 at the time of stock acquisition. The market capitalization of qualified small businesses, as defined by the "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004," should not exceed $150,000,000 at the time of stock acquisition. Market capitalization is determined based on the closing price of a share of stock multiplied by the number of outstanding shares, or by considering the most recent amounts paid for each class of stock. The rules for determining market capitalization of qualified small businesses under the "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004" include considering the closing price of a share of stock multiplied by the number of outstanding shares or the most recent amounts paid for each class of stock. Additionally, specific reporting periods and aggregation rules apply, along with rules similar to those of section 1202 for qualified small business stock. The rules for determining market capitalization of qualified small businesses under the "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004" include specific reporting periods and aggregation rules. Conforming amendments to sections 642, 643, 691, and 871 of the tax code are made to include references to sections 1202 and 1203. Section 871(a)(2) of the tax code is amended to include references to sections 1202 and 1203. Section 1044(d) is also amended to include section 1203. A new subsection is added to section 1202(b) regarding section 1203 stock. Additionally, a clerical amendment is made to the table of sections. Sec. 1203 provides an exclusion for gain from stock of small, publicly traded companies. The amendments made by this section apply to securities acquired after the enactment of this Act.
